unnormalised: Hey folks, just a quick update on some upcoming festival dates, so you can plan accordingly!
normalised: Hey folks, just a quick update on some upcoming festival dates, so you can plan accordingly!

unnormalised: First up, Janmashtami is coming up on 06/09/2024. Get ready for some dahi handi action and Krishna bhajans! Then, we have Ganesh Chaturthi, which falls on 07/09/2024 this year. Time to prep those modaks and bring out your eco-friendly Ganesha idols. And just a quick correction: I had earlier mentioned that it might fall on 08/09/2024. Apologies for the confusion!
normalised: First up, Janmashtami is coming up on sixth September two thousand and twenty four. Get ready for some dahi handi action and Krishna bhajans! Then, we have Ganesh Chaturthi, which falls on seventh September two thousand and twenty four this year. Time to prep those modaks and bring out your eco-friendly Ganesha idols. And just a quick correction: I had earlier mentioned that it might fall on eighth September two thousand and twenty four. Apologies for the confusion!

unnormalised: Durga Puja celebrations will start around 03/10/2024, and will extend till 07/10/2024. So, keep your calendars free to enjoy pandal hopping. Don’t forget Dussehra is also marked on 12/10/2024.
normalised: Durga Puja celebrations will start around third October two thousand and twenty four, and will extend till seventh October two thousand and twenty four. So, keep your calendars free to enjoy pandal hopping. Don’t forget Dussehra is also marked on twelfth October two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: And how can we forget Diwali? It is scheduled for 31/10/2024. So, get your shopping on, folks! Time to light up those diyas and gorge on some delicious mithai. Let's hope the weather is pleasant unlike last year when the temperatures peaked at 30°C on 01/11/2023.
normalised: And how can we forget Diwali? It is scheduled for thirty first October two thousand and twenty four. So, get your shopping on, folks! Time to light up those diyas and gorge on some delicious mithai. Let's hope the weather is pleasant unlike last year when the temperatures peaked at thirty degree celsius on first November two thousand and twenty three.

unnormalised: Mark these dates down, folks, and let the festivities begin! Keep checking back for more updates as we approach these dates. Happy planning!
normalised: Mark these dates down, folks, and let the festivities begin! Keep checking back for more updates as we approach these dates. Happy planning!
